pr_title: gRPC code gen to generate health and reflection stubs

timeline.bodyText: spaces will work as is on Windows and macOS?
timeline.author: gsmet

replies.bodyText:
I don't know, I don't really have a way to check.
@rsvoboda reported that it doesn't work on linux
replies.author: michalszynkiewicz

replies.bodyText: To shed some more light on it, the paths are passed as separate arguments in the ProcessBuilder's command, so they should be okay without backslashes before spaces. It's protoc that doesn't handle them properly on Linux. I don't know about other systems.
replies.author: michalszynkiewicz

replies.bodyText: Maybe @cescoffier can check on macOS if you can put together a test case?
replies.author: gsmet

replies.bodyText: @cescoffier checked and this version (without \ before spaces) worked for him on Mac
replies.author: michalszynkiewicz
